sen.j: 東向日駅（ひがしむこうえき）は、京都府向日市にある、阪急電鉄阪急京都本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, Higashimuko Station is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Higashimuko Station, located in Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Higashimuko Station, located in Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: Higashimuko Station is an aboveground station having two separate platforms serving two tracks.
Higashimuko Station is an aboveground station having two separate platforms serving two tracks.
Higashimuko Station is an aboveground station having two separate platforms serving two tracks.

sen.j: 駅舎は両ホームの梅田寄りにあり、互いのホームは地下道で連絡している。
sen.e: The station building is located on the Umeda side of the platforms which are connected by an underground passage.
The station building is located on the Umeda side of the platforms, which are connected by an underground passage.
The station building is located on the Umeda side of the platforms, which are connected by an underground passage.

sen.j: 梅田方面行ホーム側の改札口は無人となっているが、自動券売機は置かれている。
sen.e: The ticket gate on the platform for Umeda is unmanned and automatic ticket machines are installed.
The ticket gate on the platform for Umeda is unmanned, so automatic ticket machines are provided.
The ticket gate on the platform for Umeda is unmanned, so automatic ticket machines are provided.

sen.j: 競輪開催時を見据えてか、ホームは広い。
sen.e: The platforms are wide for horse-racing days.
The platforms are wide for days on which horse races are held.
The platforms are wide for days on which horse races are held.

sen.j: ※のりば番号は設定されていない。
sen.e: ※Track numbers are not assigned.
※Track numbers aren't assigned.
Platform numbers aren't assigned.

sen.e: Saigoku 33 Kannon Pilgrimage 20th Temple: Yoshimine-dera Temple (Shiawasejizo) is accessed by bus (Hankyu Bus Co.,Ltd.) or taxi from the station.
Saigoku 33 Kannon Pilgrimage 20th Temple: Yoshimine-dera Temple (Shiawasejizo) is accessible by bus (Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd.) or taxi from the station.

sen.j: 競輪開催日に限り競輪場行き無料バスが出ている。
sen.e: Free buses run for the bicycle racetrack on the days of racing.
Free buses run for the bicycle racetrack on the days that races are held.
Free buses run for the bicycle racetrack on the days that races are held.

Bus stop

sen.j: 阪急東向日（東向日を経由するバスは一旦降車客扱い後後営業所内に入った上Ｕターンして乗車客扱いするので無理に乗らないよう注意が必要）
sen.e: Hankyu Higashimuko (The bus going through Higashimuko enters the business office and returns to Higashimuko to have passengers aboard: passengers must wait for the bus to return before getting on.)
Hankyu Higashimuko: The bus going through Higashimuko enters the business office and returns to Higashimuko for boarding, but passengers must wait for the bus to return before getting on.
Hankyu Higashimuko: The bus going through Higashimuko enters the business office and returns to Higashimuko for boarding, but passengers must wait for the bus to return before getting on.

sen.j: 阪急バス（大山崎営業所向日出張所（長岡京線の70系統のみ 大山崎営業所）担当（いずれも阪急田園バスに運行委託）
sen.e: Hankyu Bus Co.,Ltd. (The operation is managed by the Muko subbranch of the Oyamazaki business office (only Route 70 of the Nagaokakyo Route is operated by the Oyamazaki business office).) (Both services are subcontracted to Hankyu Den'en Bus Co.,Ltd.)

The Oyamazaki business office manages only Route 70 of the Nagaokakyo Route, while the operations of Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd., are managed by the Muko sub-branch of the Oyamazaki business office; however, both services are subcontracted to Hankyu Den'en Bus Co., Ltd.

The operations of Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd., are managed by the Muko sub-branch of Oyamazaki business office (while only route 70 of Nagaokakyo route is operated by the Oyamazaki business office); both services are subcontracted to Hankyu Denen Bus Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 64系統：（大原野線 東山→右京の里→勝山町経由）阪急東向日行循環 ...平日13時26分発、土・休日13時56分発まで（勝山町→右京の里→東山経由）阪急東向日行循環 ...平日13時55分発、土・休日14時25分発以降

sen.j: 平成15年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約10,129人（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day was about 10,129 in 2003 (adapted from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 10,129 in 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 10,129 in fiscal year 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月1日 新京阪鉄道高槻町～京都西院開通時に東向日町駅（ひがしむこうまちえき）として開業。
sen.e: On November 1, 1928 the station was opened as Higashimukomachi Station when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: the facility was opened as Higashimukomachi Station when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: the facility was opened as Higashimukomachi Station when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 会社合併により京阪電気鉄道新京阪線の駅となる。
sen.e: On September 15, 1930 Higashimukomachi Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Higashimukomachi Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Higashimukomachi Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1943 Higashimukomachi Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Higashimukomachi Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Higashimukomachi Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）10月1日 向日町の市制施行により、東向日駅に改称。
sen.e: On October 1, 1972 the station was renamed Higashimuko Station under the municipality of Mukomachi.
October 1, 1972: the station was renamed Higashimuko Station under the municipality of Mukomachi.
October 1, 1972: the station was renamed Higashimuko Station under the municipality of Mukomachi.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 京都向日町競輪場で競輪が開催されるときは夕方の快速急行が臨時停車することがある。
sen.e: When bicycle racing is held at Kyoto Mukomachi bicycle racetrack, Rapid Express trains temporarily stop at Higashimuko Station in the early-evening.
When bicycle races are held at Kyoto Mukomachi bicycle racetrack, rapid express trains temporarily stop at Higashimuko Station in the early evening.
When bicycle races are held at Kyoto Mukomachi bicycle racetrack, rapid express trains temporarily stop at Higashimuko Station in the early evening.

sen.j: 2001年3月24日のダイヤ改正以前は昼間・夕方の一部の急行列車が臨時停車した。
sen.e: Before the schedule revision of March 24, 2001, some Express trains would temporarily stop at Higashimuko Station during the day and in the early-evening.
Before the schedule revision of March 24, 2001, some express trains would temporarily stop at Higashimuko Station during the day and the early evening.
Before the schedule revision of March 24, 2001, some express trains would temporarily stop at Higashimuko Station during the day and the early evening.

sen.j: 洛西口駅開業前は桂車庫（桂駅）配線の関係で当駅始発の列車が存在した（開業後は洛西口駅始発となった）。
sen.e: Before Rakusaiguchi Station was opened, the first train would depart from this station because of tracks in connection with Katsura depot (Katsura Station) (the first train departs from Rakusaiguchi Station after the opening of Rakusaiguchi Station).

Before Rakusaiguchi Station was opened, the first train would depart from this station due to the tracks in connection with Katsura depot (Katsura Station) (the first train departs from Rakusaiguchi Station after the opening of Rakusaiguchi Station).

Before Rakusaiguchi Station was opened, the first train would depart from this station due to the tracks in connection with Katsura depot (Katsura Station) (the first train departs from Rakusaiguchi Station after the opening of Rakusaiguchi Station).
